content.description: Fairly straight forward route up the shoreline boulder. Most holds are crimps but the foot holds are fairly solid so the route is not too difficult. Topping out is a little sketchy since the top of the boulder is mostly slopers due to wind erosion. This boulder had a lot of possible routes, this is just one I figured out. The route should still be available even in high tide, but going during the peak of high tide may be a bad idea.
content.location: Right after you get out of the parking lot path the boulder should be to your left, more towards the ocean (i.e. North East from the entrance to the parking lot).

content.description: Fairly straight forward problem. First reach to the left can be difficult, after that topping out can be a little sketchy since the top of the rock is fairly smooth.
content.location: After getting out of the parking lot the Lava Rock Boulder is to your left (north east of park lot exit). The boulder is dark colored and fairly distinct. The route is on the side away from the parking lot entrance.

content.description: Route starts holding onto a surprisingly slippery ledge, moves over to the left and then continues up the corner of the boulder via some crimps. The fall zone might be a little slippery if it was just high tide or may even be submerged during the peak of high tide. The rock below is fairly flat so a pad or two should be sufficient protection.
content.location: Just as you come out of the parking lot the boulder will be to the left closer to the shoreline/ocean (i.e. North east of parking lot entrance). Route is on a part of the boulder closer to the water.

climbs.name: Escape the Small Cave (Lava Rock Boulder)

content.description: Overall the route isn't too difficult, but some of the holds over the roof are a little hard to figure out. Depending on your beta you may be partially up side down at a certain point. The fall is a little sketchy since it is slightly angled rock, but a pad or two should be sufficient. This is my first time grading anything since I'm trying to add more routes to this area so if someone vastly disagrees with my assessment of V2-3 you're welcome to change it.
content.location: It's a dark black rock closer to the treeline. Once you get off the little trail out of the parking area it should be towards your left (i.e. it is north east of the end of the little trail)

content.description: McClellan Park is an amazing place to visit whether you're climbing or not. It has a long, rocky shore line with plenty of places to climb or simply explore. In the summer it is usually cooler than more inland areas by a few degrees, something helped by the ocean breeze. If you're in Millbridge or close by it is a must visit.All climbs here are going to be Boulder climbs as there are no rock faces near by that are tall enough for trad to my knowledge.
